website_summaries.verdict: Offers exceptional audio quality in a wireless headphone, and should particularly appeal to those that like their bass.
pros: Dual audio drives and subwoofer drivers provide an immersive audio experience
Battery charge lasts up to 40 hours
Includes a cable for wired listening
cons: Reports that the connectivity is spotty
Some felt that the headband was too thin and uncomfortable

customer_reviews.title: and he says these are better, good sound
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these headphones, he was using the beats studio and now he is using these skullcandy, and he says these are better, good sound, clear and powerful, if you love the bass, it's perfect for you. And the battery lasts a long time, he never has charged it from the purchase to now, and it has 3 weeks using it for the gym, and it's working perfectly. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, and not made to expand very far.
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great. The haptic bass is amazing. But the band across the top broke. Like it's made of cheap plastic. The metal that you see when expanding them, does NOT go all the way through. I am now past any returns here on Amazon, and Skullcandy has not gotten back to me. I was so excited to get them, and they made me happy for a few months, but now they just make me sad every time I see them broken.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marriott

customer_reviews.title: Beware! They are great but don’t last long(especially for the price) not worth it
customer_reviews.text: They worked great til they randomly broke this is the 2nd pair I have ordered and they did not last even 6 months!
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: After many years of shopping on Amazon, this is the only review I have left on a product. I bought these two months ago and like so many others here, the earphone broke off from the headband. This is a huge design flaw and for the price of these, I would've expected them to last for at least a couple of years. If you're looking for a pair of headphones, stay away and look somewhere else. These are not worth your money. The build quality is utter garbage and unless you don't mind getting them replaced every few months, I highly recommend you to opt for another pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Xyph

customer_reviews.title: Broke super easy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my son for Christmas and 4 months later they broke at the folding mechanism. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy D.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible build quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing audio quality and range, but the build quality of these headphones at the hinge is terrible. I have had these headphones for approximately three months now and it is sad to believe the it snapped with the fact being I hard use them. I would not recommend anyone to purchase these as I have been trying to get through to customer service with no avail I'm getting them repaired as I believe the one year warranty (If any) should cover them
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones!!! The base is loud enough to rattle your brain out of your nose! And the quality of sound is even better than my last pair of skull candy headphones! My last pair has lasted for years and I only upgraded because I wanted wireless!
customer_reviews.author: OtakusChaosTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound, Terrible Product!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones cost WAAAY too much to be this cheap. I've bought two pair & they haven't lasted me longer than 6 months. Every time I've owned these I've had to use super glue to keep the folding part from falling off as the plastic that folds them will split. Tape & super glue are all that's keeping these together & every month something else breaks as you can see. They sound amazing, but the materials used to make them aren't worth the price of shipping.
customer_reviews.author: King Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Superb Audio, bad quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for 3 months. The audio is great, no problems there, but the plastic they use it very brittle and cheap. After just a few months of normal use, the plastic joints joins / casing connecting the cups to the headband has broken away from the left cup, and right is beginning to crack. I had to use super glue on the left joint (the entire thing) and I had to super glue the plastic back together on the right cup. I did not expect these headphones to break so early. My last pair of headphones (Avantree) lasted around 2 years. In my option, either save up for something more reliable, or purchase a more durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Booom
customer_reviews.text: So for starters, these headphones aren't audiophile quality so if that's what you're into then look else where. That being said, these headphones are the favorite in my arsenal and I have way too many high end headphones to count. The reason for this is that haptic bass. These are amazing for listening to music but where they really shine are live performances and movies. The bass can shake your whole head. I use these in the gym all the time and they get me so pumped for my workout. Love these things.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last two weeks! Don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst money ever spent! Didn't even get one week out of them before the WiFi wouldn't connect and eventually after a week didn't even turn on.. When are all the help forms, wasn't able to fix it..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bass Head.
customer_reviews.text: So sad to say that Skull Candy has failed on this product. The original wired skull crushers are far better bass-wise. I was able to return them after trying them. I watched many YouTube reviews with not many if any saying the Skullcandy's were worth it, yet I still ordered them assuming people just didn't like bass as much as me. I was wrong it was like wearing headphones without bass and turning them up while listening to a sub woofer outside of the headphones in the next room. If you want your ears and head massaged I would recommend these. If you want to enjoy the music go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great. Sometimes the added bass sounds good, other times it feels like you're the dude whose subwoofer is tearing his old car apart. Build quality is pretty poor though. These live in my desk and the most strain they get it coming out of the drawer and going on to my head like once or twice a week to watch a movie or play a game. The part of the band that sits on the top of my head has already inexplicably bent from the strain on being on a head (my head is of reasonable size thank you). The material in the band feels like some sort of sturdy cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: skullcandy Crusher nailed it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with these head phones. I never thought I would ever pay this much for head phones but I have tried several different pair after listening to these in the store. Nothing compares not even Beats which I also listened to in the store. So I took the leap, I got them after the xmas sales so I paid a little more but still cheaper than full price. As a bass lover OMG!!! They even feel expensive. The fit is snug and secure. The ear pads are super soft. I can control the amount of bass with slider. I can crank up the bass for my work outs or dial it down for my audio books. Great Buy..
customer_reviews.author: TONIA MURRAY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphone!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a good overear headphone for a while. These did not disappoint. With the bass adjuster, you have bass when you need and you can cut it out when you don't! Bluetooth connection is great, and sound quality is great too. Battery is good too. I haven't been in a situation where I ran out of battery yet, but the included cable would help in that case. If you use the cable while you have battery, the bass effect still works. I use these at home and on long flights. Just a great headphone overall, really happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C.

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some headphones that sounded excellent, fit my (small) head and looked cute. I was not untested in spending $300 on Beats. I tried these on a target and I was absolutely blown away! The bass literally shakes the headphones and I cannot even believe the insane sound!! I looked them up and found these cheaper on amazon, so herethey are. I am absolutely mind blown. They also are a nice tight fit on my small-ish head. I recommend these. I also tried out the Beats at the store and honestly these Crushers sounded much better to me, and I got them here on amazon for $105. So worth it. And cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Sound/Bass quality is amazing, but it hurts to wear
customer_reviews.text: As many users have pointed out, these headphones either end up hurting the top of your head or your jaw. I figured it could just be a manufacturer defect, so I went ahead and ordered a pair. Unfortunately, I have both issues with these headphones. The bass is as good as it gets, and the sound quality is fantastic as well. They're not really noise canceling at all, to be honest, but that's not why I got them. Since they're quite literally a pain to wear after 30 minutes or so, I might be getting a different pair of headphones sometime soon, which kinda sucks since the sound quality is amazing on these.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Bass Gets 10 Stars
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY! I have purchased (and returned) more headphones then I care to mention before landing on these bad boys! Super comfy on the ears and head. Easy to pair and no lag from headphone to video. And the bass! THE BASS! I have Sony headphones that I paid double what I paid for this that only gets 1/10th the kick of the bass than these! I had to LOWER the bass on my phone cause of how hard these thump!! If you're looking for bass, drop everything else you are looking at and get these! Trust me! Seriously trust me and get these! You will NOT be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Michele S.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quailty but maritial fatique problem.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on March 7, 2018 & this happened today, April Fool's day 2019... about one year later. Not an April Fool's Day prank but a real problem with materials... These earphones were never off my desk or moved from place to place, and were handled by only myself. Today the right ear feel off the headband and hung by its wire. You would think that they would last longer than 1 year plus a month would result in this. Like I rated, for sound they are very good but something is lacking in the design & materials department... Time to search for a fix or Duct Tape... :(
customer_reviews.author: panos

customer_reviews.title: Decent bass adjustment and sound!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for personal use, Great for music and watching youtube videos. Easy pairing process, press and hold middle button to enable pairing. Just ashamed that they chose Micro USB as a connector, and the fact that it shuts off during charging. Pros Easy configuration Bluetooth Audio Volume Adjust Controls (It controls device audio volume) AUX Port 3.5mm! Good battery life Cons Micro USB Connector - USB C is the way to go :( Cannot use the headphones while charging
customer_reviews.author: PGMN

customer_reviews.title: Astounded!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Cowin E7 wireless headphones initially and wasn't happy with the quality. I returned them and decided to up the ante. Right out of the box (after charging) these SkullCandy Crusher headphones connected to my galaxy phone instantly. The problem with the E7's was that the Bluetooth connection was unstable and would take about 5 minutes to normalize. Glad I spent the extra $$$ These headphones have more bass than you will ever need. Update August 19, 2020 First charge held for 9 days with daily use. Impressed I am with these headphones!
customer_reviews.author: arthur brison

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound engineering design !
customer_reviews.text: The sound engineering design is awful. The lowest volume setting on these headphones is very loud so if you like to listen to music while you are in bed trying to wind down these are definitel not your headphones. Also when the volume slider in the iPhone is set to too low (close to mute) the headphones don’t emit any sound at all. Like if they were dead. Worst thing customer service representatives deny this flaw and will blame your phone for this problem and tell you to call Apple in my case as I own an iPhone XS.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aragon

customer_reviews.title: My head isn't that wide, but the fit was extremely tight.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for about 30 minutes before I called it quits due to discomfort. The sound was great, they look absolutely gorgeous, and there were no issues syncing it to my computer and phone.... but they are extremely uncomfortable. I tried adjusting them all sorts of ways, but I wasn't able to make them feel good. At the best adjustment I was able to use them for only 30 minutes before I called it quits and printed a return label. Great looking and sounding, but unbearably uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Layton Asmus

customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t suggest buying these headphones. Pros: fair price, good battery life, and easy to use Cons: too tight (squeezes ears/head too much;just look at the design angle in the picture of it), bass boost control is garbage I barley have it on most of the time, and loud ringing in ear drums if you tap them on anything. I can’t wear these for more then an hour. After that my ears are all red and hurt from the tight squeezeing design. Would give a better rating if they were comfortable. Maybe they work better for children.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones I've ever used, responsible for my tinnitus.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a loyal Skullcandy Customer for ages and will continue to be because of the Crushers. I'm wearing them as I write this and enjoying every second of it. The Bass is meaty and will rattle your skull in a pleasant way. It has many improvements where previous models needed it, such as charging port placement, the durability of the earcups and folding capabilities. Overall extremely happy with my purchase. I've had them for about 4 months now and I love them. WARNING to anyone who buys these. be wary of volume, I had a minor case of tinnitus before I got these and it's definitely worse now.
customer_reviews.author: Zezacle582

customer_reviews.title: The best pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: Of all the headphones I have tried in my life, this are the best ones. The sound is so crisp and the bass is surreal. They fit well and they are pretty light, and the battery lasts for a long time before charging it again. They look and feel great and you can even fold them and put it on a nice bag it comes with. I have them for over two years now and they still sound amazing. I highly recommend them for gaming and music. It has a mic so you can even have video chats and phone calls if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Vivas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and an awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is amazing and my daughter loves the vibration of the bass. I have to say, I am totally impressed with these headphones. I bought them for my daughter and after using them am so jealous of how great they sound that I want to get a pair for myself. They are super stylish and just feel like quality. The sound is amazing, the 40 hours of charge time is ridiculous, and they are super comfortable. Phone calls are awesome and I especially love that you can use them with an included wired jack. Great for the PS4. Oh, and the carrying case is super sweet too. Way worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy For Life!
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked Skullcandy products because the sound quality is always good and the bass is always deep. These are just awesome the review asked me to rate the noise cancelation, but these are noise isolating not cancelling. They sound is beautiful and the adjustable bass is fantastic. I've tried a few other headphones and these are by far the best you can buy for the money. They only drawback is that others can hear what you're listening to if you have the volume up high. I don't personally care. Unless someone is right next to you it's pretty mild.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Bought these to use for Oculus Quest.
customer_reviews.text: These are not the noise canceling ones! Which I’m glad because it worked out for me. I would like to hear if someone is around me while I’m playing, or if someone is talking to me. The sound quality is pretty decent but the bass is just ridiculous as in amazing! I personally don’t have the bass up all the way but I love seeing people’s reaction when I let them try out Beat Saber with it on full blast! Only downside is it’s not as great if you connect it through Bluetooth so I just use the wired connection and I rolled up the wire with twist ties, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, fragile materials
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a pair of these for each of my 4 kids over the past 2 years, and have had to repair 3 of them so far with Gorilla Glue, and 1 of them is now broken beyond repair. The curved part of the headphones that attaches the earpiece to the head band is made of plastic, and breaks easily with normal use. I have had similar breaks happen with cheaper versions of wireless headphones, so that's why I opted for these more expensive brands, but obviously anything with plastic construction is a gamble. Be aware of the stress points!!
customer_reviews.author: Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Better than Beats!
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around forever looking for the best headphones that fit my needs. And these knock all of those needs outta the park! Stay on during strenuous workouts, lifting is no problem, they connect instantly to my phone. The bass is ridiculously powerful. I’m not a bass dude, I listen to punk, rock and roll, and some metal and the high end is just as nice as the low. Battery life was the selling point and it’s the best feature, I only charge it once in a while and it seems to last forever! Would deff drop the coin for this again.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Bergren

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY TO EXPERIENCE!!
customer_reviews.text: Man these things are awesome. They were referred to by them by a electronic store clerk he said they were equal or better than BEATS with more bass and for more than half the price he was right. I've seen countless reviews about the quality of the material of the headphones. Me personally I think they're pretty good quality you have to be a ruff person to screw these things up. and as far the battery I haven't recharged since the first day that I fully charged them which was 01/16/18 (and that's with everyday play).
customer_reviews.author: Ojo Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Good company
customer_reviews.text: We have two pairs of these headphones. Sound is pretty good. I like the comfort and the ease of use. Top reason I give these 5 stars is that one of the hinges broke on one of them, We contacted skull candy and they replaced them for free. I like a company that stands by their product. My experience most places any more is that most warranties are not worth the paper they are printed on. Bravo to skull candy for backing up their word with action!
customer_reviews.author: AbqPhil

customer_reviews.title: BOOM BOOM BOOM
customer_reviews.text: The sound is clear and the bass can get so powerful that the earphones shake a little! 100% satisfaction and it's EXACTLY as advertised. Also not to mention the battery hasn't been charged in about a month and it's still fine. Probably because I only use it on the bus each day. They're also really hard to scratch up :)
customer_reviews.author: Blake N.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, rich sounding and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are versatile, long lasting, rich sounding headphones. The bass enhancer is nice when I watch a movie or am jamming out to some tunes. They can also be used on my Xbox remote and when plugged into the Xbox controller it doesn’t drain the battery. Did I say they are versatile? My only gripe is that when paired with multiple apple products it will drop the feed every thirty seconds until you turn off the Bluetooth on the paired device your not using. Once BT is disconnected it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron E

customer_reviews.title: Daily driver
customer_reviews.text: Range isn't good as it drops alot in the next room. But good artificial bass. Replaced earpads with Brainwayz velour because it was sweaty feeling with original. You loose bass isolation, but it is worth it because your ears have no ventilation with original pads, feel hot and sweaty after 30 min. Not my go to for instrumental music but it let's me walk around the room without wires. Very tight on my head though, you have to stretch it out by leaving the headphones stretched out on a small box. After a few days, it was wearable. The clamp is really, really uncomfortable if you don't stretch it out
customer_reviews.author: Kong M.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Crap.......Broke in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I only wear these headphones for a few hours each day and they broke within a couple months. The part holding on the cans is made of plastic. As an inexperienced nonprofessional human I felt the bass and noise cancellation was good. However the cheap quality of the build makes it a no. Plus I have small ears and they are incredible painful to wear for any extended amount of time and by that I mean more than 20 minutes. After wearing these for 20 minutes my ears are aching and red.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the earbuds or headphones I’ve used in my Life ( a lot). It is very clear to me that these are the best headphones that have been on my ears. The sound quality is exceptional. Everything is crystal clear and very loud. But the thing that blew me away was the BASS. It is insane on these headphones. I turned the slider all the way up and I was stunned by it. The headphones were shaking from the extreme bass. I love these and would recommend them to anyone searching for a awesome pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Quin

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones but they broke on my head.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are really great. Solid sound quality, comfortable, and the adjustable bass slaps. My only complaint is that I bought these on August 25th 2018, and on February 25th 2020, they snapped in half. I didn't throw them or do anything that would be considered "abnormal." I was putting them on and the right side broke off at the hinge. Yes, they were getting older, but they were also $130 and in my opinion should have lasted longer with how well they were upkept.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough. Fragile.
customer_reviews.text: 3 months in, they are broken and completely unusable. I go to the gym 2x and run 20 miles week (neither of which is very much to be honest) and yet the activity has caused the left cup to 100% detach in such a short time... For this reason, I would definitely not recommend for active people. For $100 I just expect a bit better build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Navy

customer_reviews.title: Haptic bass is cool at first, but sound quality overall is underwhelming.
customer_reviews.text: The haptic bass is a niche thing only some people will like. Sound quality overall is pretty poor in my opinion (strong distortion, crackling in treble, overwhelming bass when it’s not necessary even at lowest levels.) Tried listening to Bassnectar, The Weeknd, Queen, and several other artists to get a variety of music through them. Even the bass heavy songs that are focused on heavy bass don’t come across as clean and clear as they should. Just can’t recommend these over Audeze or Sennheisers.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea and execution. They do bump but aren't loud. If it's going to be this set or the 360.. buy the 360s. These are uncomfortable, are way cheaper quality and don't hit as low. I returned this set because they hurt, the cord didn't work with anything and wouldn't say connected to any BT source consistently. Yup, the 360s are twice the price. Gonna wear them for more than 15 mins at a time, like bass in the 20 - 40hz range or don't have a tiny head & ears? Just pony up the extra money. Having said all that... the old $10.00 SkullCandy Wrecking Ball earbuds blow both sets out of the water. If only they were wireless!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Man

customer_reviews.title: Big bass with fun haptic feedback and incredible battery
customer_reviews.text: I knew going in that these would be bass boosted and I'm not disappointed. The bass is big and the ability to adjust the haptic feedback slider is great. I thought it might be gimmicky, but its like having two subwoofers in the cans that you can feel without having to turn the volume up so loud that it's distorted or that you're risking hearing damage. Audio purists, stay away. You won't appreciate this bass. The best part? I listen to these for 8 hours a day and can do so for 60 hours or more between charges. They're absolutely the best pair of headphones I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Corrow

customer_reviews.title: Still love it but hinge is weak point
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge upgrade from my old skullcandy grind headphones. The crushers sound quality is 10x better than I would have expected and they dampen outside sound just enough so I can tell what's going on around me. Overall they are perfect and fit like a glove. *update* Few months later the hinge on the ear piece broke so there's that but everything else is still working. Apparently this is a common problem with these headphones just bad design on hinges. Everything else is excellent sometimes I go days without charging then I get the low battery warning but it is quick to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Music drops out on and off
customer_reviews.text: I’m very petite and they fit well and stay snugly put during weight lifting. I’m not sure if it’s the damage from vendor, shipping company or manufacturer defect, but they cut out to dead silence often :/ seems like a wire might be loose or the blue tooth connection is weak. I love the bass, however when tuned up to a little less than half, it does distort the clarity. Over all they’re okay, I don’t love the sound quality, likeI love my beat ear buds. Knowing what I do, I can’t say I’d purchase them again. The connection drop is really annoying and the product falls short of its price tag.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: They're LOUD, CRYSTAL CLEAR & have the BEST BASS of ANY HEADPHONES on the market.
customer_reviews.text: if you're a fan of music with bottom end, stop looking now, these are it. Bass like you've never experienced before with headphones. It's amazing, honestly. And on top of that, the mids and highs are above average as well! I listen to only CD quality music(CDs &Tidal), and these capture 90% of the mids and highs. They aint going outclass Sennheiser or Bose in this department, but combined with the Haptic Bass , they're EASILY THE MOST IMMERSIVE SOUND EXPERIENCE ON THE MARKET.
customer_reviews.author: Public name

customer_reviews.title: not protected enough
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding wireless headphones. Especially with the adjustable bass volume. Bad thing about this set is that where the ear pieces folds, its made of plastic. After 4 months of owning this headphone, it gave out on me. If the hinges area was made of metal instead of plastic, these headphones would be TOP KNOTCH. But unfortunately, it broke on me. Natural wear and tear will make these go bad but only 4 months of occassional use for me was pretty devastating. Wanting to buy another set but until its built better, it aint happening.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Connections are difficult to maintain.
customer_reviews.text: Updated 11/7/18, I went to use these today and the headband that attaches to the ear piece was broken. Send that the plastic has stressed enough to become brittle. Skullcandy has a 2 year limited warranty, which I completed and now waiting on more details. I'll update my review when more information is available. These sound great but are difficult to get to consistently connect to devices. I keep turning off the Bluetooth feature on my cell so that I can connect to my Chromebook. And even this does not work. The only work-around is to completely reboot the Chromebook and re-pair the headphones. For what you pay for these, it shouldn't have this type of problem.
customer_reviews.author: All True NO BS Review

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bass and good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Really love these headphones. The bass quality is really great with the haptic drivers. I get more or less the same amount of bass from my car subwoofer. The only downside is that the bass stops from time to time but only for short periods. I think it is because of the bass detection for the drivers that tries to decide what is low frequencies are good for the haptic drivers. Unless maybe I need to update my firmware. Other than that. The battery life is excellent, I hardly have to charge these things.
customer_reviews.author: Ritesh Kanjee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The best headphones I’ve owned! These things will literally bounce off your ears with so much bass. If you love bass, you’ll love these headphones! No joke. It gives me flashbacks of the 80-90’s when I had a bass system in my car. They hit that hard. I’m going to order another pair just for back up. They fit good on my head. They are really simple to work too. Plus, the price is awesome considering I went to a store and they wanted $149 for them. That’s how I discovered them in the first place. For $106, it’s totally worth it trust me. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bush Dawg

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with these headphones 🎧 I am a huge fan of bass and these have a LOT! I often watch tv shows on my iPhone and wear headphones...the great thing about these is that you can turn the bass up and down! When I listen to music I love a lot of bass and these literally rattle my brain! Haha I never need the bass turned all the way up and that's the way I like it. I had a set of beats by Dre and these are way better in my opinion! I guess it also depends on what you want them for. Oh and the quality of these is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: christies_classy_beauty

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced...but good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Busted after less than a year. $100 down the drain Update: contacted the manufacturer and they gave me a $100 store credit. Stock was extremely limited so my only real option without losing value or spending more was to get the same pair in a different color/style. Holding up well so far but it’s only been a few months. Updated to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent earphones with big bass.
customer_reviews.text: Really love my skullcrushers. The bass can be turned up ridiculously high but that's just for fun for me. I use them mainly for PC gaming and they work flawlessly. Build quality is decent, no weak points that I can see and they hold up well on my big head. Battery life is excellent. Never had them run dead and I may charge them every other week with causual use. Definitely recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Love these. I’ve had them for several months now
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I’ve had them for several months now. My only complaint is the volume level... I feel like it could be louder? My Apple headphones end up being louder, with more room for ditstractions to filter in! Comfortable none he less and doesn’t hurt my ears — like most do. I personally prefer these over beats. The bass option is aaaaamazing!
customer_reviews.author: Skyefye

customer_reviews.title: Need battery life?
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation is ok the sound quality is good but nothing special. The real good kicker here is the battery life. Like yeah they last so many hours it's great. I think it's rated to last about 60hrs but I can easily get a bit more than that if I turn off the rumble. Like 65hrs? Either way I'm very impressed with the battery life if u need one that lasts then this is one to get.
customer_reviews.author: snowman

customer_reviews.title: “Skull Crushing” Bass
customer_reviews.text: So first and foremost I am a huge bass head. So I naturally love these headphones. I’m by no means an audiophile but the highs and lows are right where they should be and the bass control slider is a game changer. No doubt I’ll be deaf before I am 40. By the way.... I’m okay with that! If you like deep “Skull Crushing” bass then these are for you!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy J. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Cancelled out my kid
customer_reviews.text: I just received these as a gift so I might need to modify later;however, my initial review is... the sound and bass are amazing, they fit quite snug which is nice but I have a sensitive jaw and it hurts a bit but they might break in. I danced around and cleaned, they didn’t slide or slip at all. The noise cancelling was decent, I coined the hear my 8 year old whine which is the main goal right? I think I’ll wear them daily for awhile just to test them out more, and avoid listening to Gideon’s Minecraft stories
customer_reviews.author: James kopack

customer_reviews.title: The negative reviews are right :(
customer_reviews.text: I thought people breaking this were just mishandling it but it broke for me on the 3rs day!!! Simply when opening it before putting it on my head. Btw I dont even have a large head. Im sooooo dissapointed because I own a set of skullcandu earphones and they have been solid over the years. Also the sound on these feel so cheap anf lack luster, the bass is medium amd exaggerated. Imagine if aound could physically punch your ear drums (not in a good way) its not even a deep bass. 2 star only because they look so good aesthetically.
customer_reviews.author: P. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my product was defective. The audio crackles on some devices even when using the cable. The Bluetooth connection is not stable at all, it keeps disconnecting and reconnecting constantly, I've tried on PC, Mac, Android phones... These issues are not present with my Arctis Bluetooth headphones, so it is indeed an issue with the Crushers. They push too tight into your ears and jaw, it is painful after one hour or so, but the good news is that they do not wiggle at all, perfect for commuting, I found that they are tolerable when wearing a hat.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Campos

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound, Disappointing Durability
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on these is really nice, and I have never had a problem with the wiring or electronics, but the arms that hold the ear cups in place are disappointingly flimsy. My first pair broke within 8 months of normal use, with no abuse what-so-ever. Simply the act of taking the headphones on and off eventually caused the plastic to snap. This is not a new problem, and seems to be quite common among other users. An update to reinforce the arms with either a sturdier plastic design or replace them with actual aluminum, like the internal headband, would be enough for me to give them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Connor S.

customer_reviews.title: High quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best headphones money can buy. Provide an incubator for the world with the noise cancellation. Wearing these is like stepping into a different all encompassing world. Very comfortable and lightweight, with a nice sleek look and style. The materials are all high quality and you can really see they were manufactured to endure. The battery life is also amazing. Literally can last for a couple of days with steady usage. Charges fast too. The sound performance is also second to none. Turn up the base and feel your soul crank!
customer_reviews.author: D. Gaskins

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They are halfway decent. Are they worth the price. Short answer: no. The Bluetooth functionality is super spotty at best. I've had to re-pair it at four times for each phone I've used it on. The sound quality is very bass'y, but outside of that, it is flat and unamusing at best. I wouldn't recommend buying this. I've been buying Skullcandy since I was in middle school (almost two decades ago), and I've I've only been disappointed once. This is that one time.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Fresa

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY GOT A GOOD NON DEFECTIVE PAIR. VERY GOOD SOUND AND COMFORT FOR THE MONEY. 5 STARS.
customer_reviews.text: VERY GOOD SOUND AND COMFORT FOR THE MONEY. MUST BE VERY CAREFUL WITH THEM AS THEY ARE DELICATE AND YOU MUST SPREAD THEM VERY GENTLY AND GINGERLY WHEN TAKING THEM ON AND OFF OR THEY WILL SNAP AND OR BREAK IF NOT CAREFUL. DEFINITELY BEAUTIFUL CONSTRUCTION AND SOUND IS ELOQUENT AND COMFORT IS TOP NOTCH. I LOVE THESE CRUSHERS A LOT. I FOUND BASS PERFECT WITH JUST KEEPING THE HAPTIC BASS SLIDER TOTALLY DOWN.
customer_reviews.author: MARK P.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift satisfied with purchase my friend says it’s the best headset he’s received.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a friend and I tested it out before giving it to him. I loved it. If I weren’t blind I needed to hear but was around me I would buy one. The music was great the base went all the way turned up as loud and the noise canceling was awesome. Highly recommend the product especially since it’s cheaper on here than in the store. The case that it comes in is soft and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love these so far
customer_reviews.text: The “Crusher” effect is what makes these worth it, and that is why I chose these over the Bose set I was preparing to purchase. Sound is clear and highly desirable. My only suggestion is that if you have these syncing with more than one device, make sure that only one of them has their Bluetooth active at a time. This headset with automatically sync with at least two (that’s all I have it synced with at the moment) devices at once, and that will create a slightly annoying static “click” that will disrupt the music listening experience.
customer_reviews.author: TK Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I usually can't find a pair of headphones that fit well and with good quality sound. I have a hard time with ear buds because those tend to hurt my ears after about 30 minutes. These have all of the qualities I was looking for - over the ear, noise cancellation, sound quality and a little bass. Even my husband was amazed at the bass controls. I originally found these at target on the "try me" stand, and once I tried them, I had to have them. Amazon price was about $40 cheaper than target. I would recommend these to anyone that is as picky as I am about headphones/earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: K. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Eargasm
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I've been too busy enjoying them to write a review, but gotta give credit where credit is due so here you are reading my review...these are everything I've ever wanted from a pair of headphone, noise quality, adjustable bass, noise cancelation, you know name it I don't consider myself an audiophile by any means, but these are the best audio experience I've ever experienced since I blew out my poor car's speakers and subwoofers :'(
customer_reviews.author: Jordan E. Fuson

customer_reviews.title: at $100 These are worth it
customer_reviews.text: So I paid about $100 for these after taxes, and I am very impressed with how good these sound. I bought these mainly because I am a bass freak and these definitely deliever. Skull candy covers your purchase for up to 2 years after buying these but I have a lot of confidence that these will last. They are so tight against my head sometimes it hurts but I think I'll get used to it. The sound is worth it. And the way it vibrates on my head makes these different than any other overear headphones I've tried. Jamming with that new song you just added is when you're gonna realize these headphones transports you completely.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound !!! Cheap Plastic !!!
customer_reviews.text: The sound on these headphones is great. If you like Bass they will sound Fantastic. The problem is the cheap plastic they are made out of. I've only had them 2 months and they are starting to crack where the headband retracts. I would have to say to anyone wanting these to stay away. I'm bummed the sound is great but there is no way they will last. If your thinking you will just use them at you desk and be gentle with them they will still break. It's the plastic they are made of it's brittle and will crack.
customer_reviews.author: DaBizz

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Base ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have great boosted bass with enough adjustment to allow me to choose the amount of bass I prefer. I had to wait a couple of weeks to get the "deep red" color, but it was worth the wait. Cutting the cord with "Bluetooth" give several laptop computers and a SanDisk Clip phenomenal sound. While I haven't timed how long the battery charge lasts, it will easily last several days of normal use. This is one of the best purchases I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Cousin

customer_reviews.title: Not at all a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Not at all disappointed. I've always owned Skullcandy ear buds for over 10 years and finally got me my first pair of Crushers. Love the sound quality and the battery life awesome! Says ten hours but I've been able to get over double that before needing to charge it. If you headphones that don't break the bank and put out what they say, this the set.
customer_reviews.author: Beau N.P.

customer_reviews.title: Folding feature is flawed and will break.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are great, Except, they have a design flaw. The folding feature is good, but because of the materials used it breaks. We have gone through two headphones in less than 6 months. The warranty coverage is awesome, but a product should last longer than 3-6 months. Plastic is used for the hinge is a terrible choice for a part that bends all the time. Luckily, skullcandy has great customer service and we generally love their products.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Chang

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit, VERY bad Bluetooth. Pass on these headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the worst pair of headphones I’ve ever had. The fit is tight on the head and very uncomfortable. The bass and tremendous battery life are what it has going for it. The Bluetooth is VERY spotty and annoying to have to deal with. Overall, I am extremely dissatisfied with these headphones and would get a refund if I could. First time trying SkullCandy and not impressed. Won’t be buying from this company again. I got new headphones that just put these to shame. Another issue that I've noticed is that these feel cheaply made and I can hear the echo of the metal if I bump my head on something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best i ever heard until now
customer_reviews.text: It is true what they say. Will blow your brains out. Good sound , good bass if you want it, and they are loud. I love bass but on some tracks cannot really use the max volume. The adjustable bass is very helpful, as some tracks lacks bass. Only when wired sound will not be loud, only if you use an amplifier, but on Bluetooth they will destroy your ears. Good job with this product, hope to see some noise cancelling in next model and maybe the buttons can be revised as you cannot really feel them.
customer_reviews.author: victor stefan

customer_reviews.title: Isn't good keeping connection
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 months, and over all I like them. My only complaint is that the audio is always clutching out randomly. It is hard to watch videos cuz it glites for 30 seconds at a time ever coupke of minutes. It does it with every device I Bluetooth with, so its the headphones. It is frustrating and I wish I would have bought a different head set.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler E Garff

customer_reviews.title: So much to love
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, great value, great brand. These headphones are bass heavy, but well balanced in my opinion. If you have a big head like me, these may be a little tight, but I fixed that easy enough. I like that these are not overly flashy or heavily branded. The battery life is stupid long! If you plan on using these often as hands free device for phone calls do note that a subtle but noticeable high pitched tone may be heard. I don't find it too distracting, but it is there. Overall amazing sound and value!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this item...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this back in Dec 2019, loved it. I cleaned it after every use, stashed away neatly in my drawer so it can stay clean. But after sometime, the seaming on the headphones are coming off, reference on pictures. It's heart breaking, and it doesn't seem like it's fixable either. Sound quality is superb though, love the ANC option. Bass is great for my own taste. Really wished the seaming could have stayed longer. Hopefully I get some tips to fix it or not too sure if I can recommend it for its physical quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anh

customer_reviews.title: They Break
customer_reviews.text: In under 2 years, these break. Normal wear and tear. I took good care of them, and they just snap at the base of the headphone. I'm leaving a crappy review because manufacturing NEEDS to make better build quality. Looks really ugly when you try to glue back together. Super Glue only worked for a day, not going to spend more time on these, they will go in the garbage, and I'll never buy from skullcandy, until I see two year reviews after one of their products comes out. I got a buddy of mine to buy these, and his snapped in about 8 months. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stanley

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and snug
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my fiance, she loves them! Arrived fast and no damage. The vibration setting for the bass is interesting. Set it high and it vibrates your ears some...they work great for watching a movie when you wanna keep the house quiet and not wake anyone! Great buy! For gym use they seem to work well...they are snug and don't fall off but still very comfortable. Might not like these if you sweat alot though. I dont like over the ear headphones during a huge sweat.. lol
customer_reviews.author: Chad pennington

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy properly named these!!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones totally blew my mind!! This is the best money I've spent in a long time. If you want a rockin pair of headphones, this is the pair for you! They will rattle your skull! Bass is amazing! Skullcandy crushed it on this one!! Highs and mids are crisp and clean. Very comfortable to wear. Packaging was also very impressive. Includes a very quality bag to carry your new favorite headphones in, along with cord to plug directly into your phone if you choose to do so. So spoil yourself. You deserve the great sounds of these awesome headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great till they cracked and broke
customer_reviews.text: Update: They were awesome till they formed a small crack where the ear cups connect to the headband. Normal everyday use, nothing rough but constant pressure in this area from pulling them apart to put them on causes a crack to form. Very sad as the sound was great. Original post: It vibrates my brain. Good sound quality and appears well made. Buttons are so so and time will tell if they hold up. It power ups quick and connects to my S9 phone very fast. Once on and music is playing, I cant hear anything else going on around me.
customer_reviews.author: WintersEdge

customer_reviews.title: If you are a basshead these ain't it. Not true bass!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. The bass sounds artificial. It's not even hitting on the parts of the song like my Sony 950bts do. Hope this helps someone. Stick with your Sonys. I should have got the xb950n1. Also, I have the bass slider all the way up and where am I supposed to be blown away at? This is not true bass. You can tell. Shouldve known, it's Skullcandy. * If you get a chance to try them out before buying try this song for example: Lido & Canblaster -Rush Hour On the 950bts you will hear and feel the bass drop at the beginning of the song. On the skullcandy it's nonexistent
customer_reviews.author: Angela D

customer_reviews.title: The Crushers, the Legend
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful in the white and brown. They look attractive although deep down these are the same dirty, nasty, head-shaking experience that few can forget. If you haven't heard the Crushers yourself, then get these at this insanely good price. Headphones will never be the same; you will either love this experience or hate it. I love the effect. It becomes a hobby to try and find the lowest, cleanest bass lines in music.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm GrangerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: No.
customer_reviews.text: The haptic bass is a nice idea but it only affects a VERY narrow band of the frequency range (I think around 50Hz) so basically the really low bass notes below this don't benefit from it at all. It's weird. Kind of like when you're in the bathroom of a concert and the building itself has a resonant frequency and you keep hearing the same thump-thump-thump sound as you're trying to take a leak. These headphones have a very "scooped" bass-heavy frequency curve so you'll have to feed your music through some sort of EQ before they make it to your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Cannot adjust bass EQ and will not boost lower end bass levels.
customer_reviews.text: The bass boost preset EQ is pretty bad. It does noting to super low bass and only boosts mid to high bass ranges. I got these to play beat saber with my Rift S and the sound quality just wasn't great. It would be different if you could tweak the EQ settings through software but apparently that's not an option.
customer_reviews.author: LBKewee

customer_reviews.title: nice setup, about what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, easy to use. I like the BASS control so I can quickly adjust to different audio inputs. Mic seems to work well, used during a zoom meeting in the car the other day (passenger). Range is great, from my laptop I can walk into the other room before they start to cut out. Time will tell on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

customer_reviews.title: Clean mids and highs but subwoofer bass
customer_reviews.text: It feels premium, very nice to the touch. Everytime i take them out to use the feel is screams expensive. Sound wise they are now my favorite to go to. The sound stage is pretty clean and the bass will shake you quite literally. Its more than a listening session these headphones are a experience. I can no longer use my earbuds which share the same frequency response on paper and i use to think hit hard. I now think i should've got the crusher360 if it feels and sounds better than these but you cant go wrong with the crushers.
customer_reviews.author: Miran Sidoine

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound and the bass in this headphone. It is good for the price. The reason I gave it 4 star is because I am having connection issues with my Ipod. When I am at the gym and there are a lot of people with wireless headphone, I get a lot of interference. If anyone knows how to fix this issue, let me know. Also, I can hear outside noise but at this price point cannot complain.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great battery
customer_reviews.text: Minus 1 star because it doesnt have a travel case. The sound quity is great and the battery life, Dubai to Houston no problem! If it had a case, it would get 5 stars!. UPDATE - after 1 year and two months of light use (only when on flights) the headset broke where the right side ear broke off. The plastic cracked which the ear fits in. The speakers still works, but it falls apart now since it will not hold it tight. sad, because they still have great sound. So...minus 1more star due to poor durability
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wojtas

customer_reviews.title: Loses connection a lot to bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but always loses connection to bluetooth, this includes apple and android Bluetooth products. I would not buy this again or recomend this product due to that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Love these. They last.
customer_reviews.text: These pictures are after 4 months of nearly daily use. Still love these. I wear them 5-6 hours a day at work and they never bother me. The battery lasts me over a week on one charge. The charging process is quick. Some reviews say these break within three months. I wanted to wait and do my review after that mark. Four months and still going strong. The bass is a fun plus. :) Update. I’ve had these almost a year, still going strong 💪
customer_reviews.author: Mother of dragons

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: While I did enjoy very much the bass boost and the noise cancelling, Bluetooth would not connect to either my phone or tablet. Neither device could recognize them, plugged in or not. The tiny pamphlet included did not help in any way as to figuring out this problem. Google did not help either. I also could not get them to turn off, and then next morning, even though fully charged, would not turn on. Instructions included need to be clear and thorough, not just some pictures and arrows.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Feel the bass go down your neck
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what to say other than these headphones are.... AWESOME. They're comfortable, controls and overall design is clean and simple. The bass will rattle your face. You'll never need the bass slider more than halfway, but it's nice to know it can be pushed even further to vibrate my eyes. Quality sound and quality build for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it..
customer_reviews.text: I returned mine after one day of use.The sound is muddy with the overpowered bass but of course that is expected. What makes this a 2-star for me is the Bluetooth quality. The sound keeps dropping out for a fraction of a second every few minutes or so which gets extremely annoying. The bass slider does not works well either as the bass effect would drop in and out throughout a song which is weird. The only good thing about this is that it's fairly well-built on the outside and nice looking , but who cares about that when the tech inside is broken.
customer_reviews.author: Khoa

customer_reviews.title: Gamble so far...
customer_reviews.text: These are so far my absolute favorite for bluetooth - over the ear headphones as they sound incredible, the bass is so good you feel it, and they are supremely comfortable. However, after owning them for 31 days they simply stopped turning on and stopped charging. I don't understand why but I like them so much I am trying another pair. If it happens again I will have to take a pass on these. I give 3 for this second pair being a gamble -if they don't stop working these headphones would easily be 5 star from me. ...if they die, it's a 1.
customer_reviews.author: Half Brindle

customer_reviews.title: One word: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: If you listen to hip-hop, or just plain like a little more bass in your songs, look no further. Very impressed with the sound. Based on some reviews, I was expecting a muddy and lifeless mid-range. This was not the case at all. There is no other headphone out there today that thumps like Skull Crusher. I personally only move the slider to about 25% of max, and I find that it is plenty. Better sound than the Beats Pro, which I also own. Definitely hits deeper no doubt about it. And thr battery life is incredible. Fun set of headphones, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tio Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is phenomenal. Comfortable even with my glasses on. Best sounding headphones I ever owned. Mic is ok. I usually end up taking calls with these outside, but I quickly take them off and just use my phone mic instead because I can't hear myself (for obvious reasons), and I've been told my voice isn't very clear. That doesn't matter much to me though because I'm using these primarily for listening to music. I wear these every day on my bus commute to work and they block out all the crazy people yelling over the sound of the obnoxiously loud bus.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: 11th pair of over the ear or ear buds in the last 4 years. I have been trying to find a good set of head phones for work and these are by far the best at their price point. Battery life has been good, I can get 3 complete 12 hour shifts at work out of them without needing to charge them. Range could be a bit better but it's still pretty good. They fit comfortably around the ear and on top of the head. Wish skull candy would start giving a decent length charging cable though. Works great for phone calls too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew I.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, crappily made
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have incredible sound quality, like out of this world. However they are falling apart. They’ve broken in all the same places on both sides. Considering how much money I’ve spent on them I just have been gorilla glueing them back together. You’d think for the price they’d hold up to wear better. For reference I’ve only had these since November 2017, it’s February 2018. The first break happened in December 2017.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sound with a nice bass adjustment. I’ve watched many movies and countless hours of music with this headset. I love the bass adjuster for whatever mood I’m in. The battery life is incredible. I use these for at least two hours each night and I charge them about once every 2-3 weeks. The sound quality is superb. Crisp highs and thundering lows. They have a nice over ear comfortable fit as well. Will buy again (or a newer model) in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: Skullcandy Crusher Wireless Over-Ear Headphone - Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackCrusher offers an audio experience unlike any other on the market – one that puts you front row for your favorite music and movies. Utilizing two full-range 40mm audio drivers and additional dual bass drivers, Crusher transforms your audio into an immersive experience you don’t just hear, you feel. Pair that with wireless technology and up to 40 hours of battery life, and you have a premium Bluetooth headphone with powerful bass you can feel. Frequency Response: 20Hz - 20KHz.Impedence: 33 Ohms±15%(acoustic), 13 Ohms(crusher) ohm
feature_bullets: Rapid Charge: 10 Minutes = 3 Hours; 40 Hours of Total Battery Life
Microphone, Call, Track, and Volume Control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars8,293 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
